title: TB only Downloads 3 or 4 messages at a time
content:
For the past week or two, TB only downloads 3 or 4 (never more than 4) messages at a time from my Gmail. Now, instead of just starting TB and it downloading all new messages, I have to click Get Messages multiple times to retrieve everything. I have seen similar questions here and the answers have all been variations of blaming the user. So: a) I have not changed any settings. b) It used to download all available messages, whether when TB started up or when I clicked Get Messages. c) Just now on starting TB, it took 6 clicks to retrieve 20 message. They are all text, no attachments, so the total size would be in KB, not MB. d) Using Speedtest, my connection speed is over 300 MB/second so it isn't a connection speed limit on my side. And I doubt it is a speed limitation on Gmail's side.

With all of that in mind, I would appreciate any suggestions of what could be causing the problem and what the fix might be.
creator: firefox1043

title: Thunderbird slow downloading/opening email
content:
Specs: TB 115.14.0 Win 10 22H2 Windows Defender FIOS internet Gmail accounts via POP3

Starting a couple of TB updates back, my system has been slow downloading and opening emails from gmail accounts via POP3. When I check for new messages, it starts downloading instantly, but then there can be a pause with the Windows hourglass shown for ~5-10 sec before downloading resumes.

When I click a new email in any of my inboxes, it opens a fully formatted TB page with the To/From/Subject all shown correctly, but the message content area is blank white. May take up to ~10 sec to display the message content. Doesn't matter if the content is plain text or includes images or with/without attachments. Same thing can happen with emails previously received and read.

Don't think this is an ISP issue because Firefox 129.0 isn't having delays opening web pages.

No errors reported by: chkdsk /r on both boot SSD and internal data HDD DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth sfc /scannow

Any suggestions? Thanks!
creator: rohe1318

title: NordVPN Threat Protection Pro warning re;Vulnerability of Mozilla Thunderbird

title: Retrieve deleted emails
content: I had about 170 notes in my Notes APP on my iphone. I didn't know that there was an email sent for each to my email folder. I had a lot of emails in my Inbox, so I started deleting them. Since I didn't know the emails from my Notes APP were in there, they were deleted. After doing a lot of looking I finally found the Notes in the Trash folder. For some reason they have now disappeared from my Trash folder. There were a lot and they looked different than normal emails. I know I didn't delete them on purpose or by accident. I don't know where they are. Do you have any idea if they can be found anywhere? I had notes in there going back ten years. I just don't understand why they would disappear. I don't know when this happened, though. It could have been one to two weeks ago. Thank you, Nancy

title: The preview area covers the topic list
